message.content:
cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SD, cs.CL 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) - This paper proposes a new technique for learning the input and recurrent weight matrices in Echo State Networks (ESNs), which are a type of Recurrent Neural Network (RNN). Therefore, it is highly likely that this paper belongs to the cs.NE sub-category. 
2. cs.LG (Machine Learning) - The proposed technique involves exploiting the linearity of the activation function in the output units of an ESN to simplify the learning of the input and recurrent weight matrices. This is a machine learning technique, and hence, it is likely that this paper belongs to the cs.LG sub-category. 
3. cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) - ESNs are a type of RNN that have been used in various AI applications such as speech recognition and time series prediction. Therefore, it is possible that this paper belongs to the cs.AI sub-category. 
4. cs.SD (Sound) - The experimental results in this paper involve phone state classification, which is related to sound processing. Therefore, it is possible that this paper belongs to the cs.SD sub-category. 
5. cs.CL (Computation and Language) - The experimental results in this paper involve phone state classification, which is related to speech recognition. Therefore, it is possible that this paper belongs to the cs.CL sub-category
